com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j

Interface HttpStatusCodeProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultHttpStatusCodeProvider

    public interface HttpStatusCodeProvider

    A status code provider maps an HTTP status code to a JSON-RPC result code (e.g. -32000 -> 500).

    From version 2.0 on the JSON-RPC specification is not explicitly documenting the mapping of result/error codes, so this provider can be used to configure application specific HTTP status codes for a given JSON-RPC error code.

    The default implementation DefaultHttpStatusCodeProvider follows the rules defined in the JSON-RPC over HTTP document.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getHttpStatusCode(int resultCode)
      Returns an HTTP status code for the given response and result code.
      java.lang.Integer getJsonRpcCode(int httpStatusCode)
      Returns result code for the given HTTP status code

    • Method Detail

      • getHttpStatusCode

        int getHttpStatusCode(int resultCode)
        Returns an HTTP status code for the given response and result code.
        Parameters:
        resultCode - the result code of the current JSON-RPC method call. This is used to look up the HTTP status code.
        Returns:
        the int representation of the HTTP status code that should be used by the JSON-RPC response.

      • getJsonRpcCode

        java.lang.Integer getJsonRpcCode(int httpStatusCode)
        Returns result code for the given HTTP status code
        Parameters:
        httpStatusCode - the int representation of the HTTP status code that should be used by the JSON-RPC response.
        Returns:
        resultCode the result code of the current JSON-RPC method call. This is used to look up the HTTP status
